title: Statement by the Press Secretary | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
December 20, 2010

 



Statement by the Press Secretary





On Monday, December 20, 2010, the President signed into law:
	 
	S. 3817, the “CAPTA Reauthorization Act of 2010,” which reauthorizes through FY 2015 and makes changes to the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act and related programs to prevent and treat child abuse and family violence, eliminate barriers to permanent adoption, and address the circumstances that lead to child abandonment.
